title: Citi, Avina and Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay Conduct Research to Contribute to the Country's National Financial Education Strategy
summary: Asunción, Paraguay - Citi, working through the Citi Foundation and in partnership with Avina and Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay, is conducting research for contributing a glossary of financial terms to the government's Office of National Financial Education Strategy (ENIF).
tag-1: Citi, Avina and Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay Conduct Research to Contribute to the Country's National Financial Education Strategy
tag-3: Asunción, Paraguay – Citi, working through the Citi Foundation and in partnership with Avina and Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay, is conducting research for contributing a glossary of financial terms to the government's Office of National Financial Education Strategy (ENIF).
tag-4: Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay recently organized its representatives to work on validating part of the concepts that will be incorporated into the National Financial Education Strategy's glossary of financial terms. Previous research collected these terms from an analysis of documents freely available in Paraguay and other countries in the region, including Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Peru, as well as the United Kingdom and United States. The research is being carried out in this country thanks to the support of the Citi Foundation as part of the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards program.
tag-5: The goal of the project is to contribute to the output of the National Financial Education Strategy's working groups, especially in the area of financial education. The glossary of financial terms is designed to help consumers understand products and services and provide information that helps them develop their financial management skills.
tag-6: The final result of this work will be presented on December 6, 2016, when more than 35 microentrepreneurs are scheduled to take part in a Financial Education Training Day. The participants were selected from among more than 250 candidates from around the country. The winners of the 2016 Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards will be announced at the same event.
tag-7: Participating in the research to compile the glossary of terms were representatives of the ENIF and financial education experts from organizations such as the Paraguayan Banking Association (ASOBAN), Association of Finance Companies (ADEFI), the Central Bank's Superintendency for Financial Inclusion and the Ministry of Social Action's Financial Inclusion Unit, as well as organizations with an emphasis on financial education, among them the Paraguayan American Chamber of Commerce Foundation (AMCHAM), the Principios de Vida Foundation, Paraguay Educa and Fundación Capital.
tag-8: For more information about the Citi Microentrepreneurship Award, please visit www.premioemprendedores.com.py.

tag-11: The Citi Foundation  The Citi Foundation works to promote economic progress in communities around the world and focuses on initiatives that expand financial inclusion. Through a "More than Philanthropy" approach, Citi's business resources and human capital enhance our philanthropic investments and impact. For more information, visit www.citifoundation.com.
tag-12: Avina Avina is a foundation that seeks to contribute to sustainable development in Latin America by promoting the establishment of links and partnerships between social and business leaders and articulating mutually acceptable action plans.
tag-13: Red de Microfinanzas de Paraguay Red de Microfinanzas de Paraguay is an umbrella organization for microfinance institutions in Paraguay. It is made up of organizations involved in the microfinance industry, including banks, finance companies, NGOs specializing in microcredit, and co-ops. Its mission and vision are to provide socially responsible leadership for microfinance policies, strategies and programs designed to improve quality of life for the country's microentrepreneurs.
